roleset.name: fall
roleset.note: SLIP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'slip' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison with 'fall'. No VNcls (from slip.01-v)
SLIP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on all slip-v rolesets. Corresponds to VNcls split-23.2, calibratable_cos-45.6-1, send-11.1. (from slip.01-n)

role.descr: end point, end state of arg1

example.name: args 1-4
example.text: Reed International PLC said that net income for the six months ended Oct. 1 slipped 5% to #89.7 million [$ 141.9 million], or 16 pence a share, from #94.8 million [$149.9 million], or 17.3 pence a share.
example.arg: net income for the six months ended Oct. 1
to # 89.7 million [$141.9 million], or 16 pence a share
from #94.8 million [$149.9 million], or 17.3 pence a share

example.name: arg1
example.text: He predicts a downward move in dollar - mark trade and a less dramatic slip in dollar - yen ,

example.name: args 1 and 5
example.text: NESN can count me in as one of the few thousand or more responsible for their slip in ratings.

example.name: args 1, 3,4
example.text: I personally feel the announcement of BES 5.0 was pretty huge, but perhaps it?s slip from a tentative scheduled release from 6 months ago to a more firm date of one year from now was perhaps the biggest news from WES.
example.arg: from a tentative scheduled release from 6 months ago
to a more firm date of one year from now

roleset.name: change location
roleset.note: SLIP-V NOTES: Comparison with 'move'. Member of VNcls split-23.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from slip.02-v)

example.name: ergative
example.text: If the economy slips into a recession, then this isn't a level that's going to hold.''

example.name: transitive
example.text: While Mary's back was turned, John slipped a panful of hot cookies into his pants.

roleset.name: give
roleset.note: SLIP-V NOTES: Comparison with 'send'. Member of VNcls send-11.1-1. (from slip.03-v)

example.name: sneaky legislators
example.text: Members-1 find it easy to doctor legislation by [*]-1 slipping in special provisions that could never survive in the cold light of day.
example.arg: special provisions that could never survive in the cold light of day
